intro: Hedyotis, commonly known as the "bladder campion," is a genus of flowering plants in the Rubiaceae family. These plants are typically small herbs with opposite, often hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that can be white, pink, or red. They are native to temperate and subtropical regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Hedyotis species often thrive in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Some species are cultivated for their ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
